name: Giraffe o'Clock (LD50)
description:
Ludum Dare 50 Link

-----------------------------------------------------

Giraffe o'Clock is now available on both Windows and on Web - Please adjust volume through volume slider as options are not an option yet (:

IMPORTANT NOTE: The LD version has a hitbox glitch that sometimes gets the player stuck inside walls. Do not fear; press Start/Escape, go back to the main menu, and continue your save file - the timer will go back to what it was when you first entered that stage. A fix is on the way in the post-jam version.

-----------------------------------------------------

GIRAPHICS: Sylbie

PROGRAMMING/MUSIC/SFX: Kepsert

EVERYTHING ELSE: Combined effort!

-----------------------------------------------------

PLOT

Brother Billy is about to turn off the lights; it’s bedtime after all. It just so happens to be that Kid Giraffe is scared of the dark and he’s not quite ready for the lights to go off yet. Logically he goes on an adventure to delay, or perhaps completely evade, the inevitable. Meet a cast of characters through a jolly world of witty dialogue, adorable graphics, while transcending space and time in the one way that makes sense: through dance.

-----------------------------------------------------

KEYBOARD CONTROLS

- Menu:

Select button: Enter

- Game

Up/Down/Left/Right: WASD or Arrow keys

Jump: Space

Dash: Left shift or Left alt

Pause: Escape

- Minigame:

Up/Down/Left/Right: WASD or Arrow keys or GHJK

- Dialogue

Continue: Space

-----------------------------------------------------

GAMEPAD CONTROLS

- Menu:

Select button: A / South Button

- Game

Up/Down/Left/Right: Left Stick / Dpad

Jump:  A / South Button

Dash: B / East Button

Pause:  Start

- Minigame:

Up/Down/Left/Right: Left Stick / Dpad / ABXY / Right Stick

- Dialogue

Continue: A / South Button

-----------------------------------------------------

ACCESSIBILITY

Currently available:

- Easy, Normal, Hard difficulties.

Depending on which difficulty you pick, you'll have more time to beat the game. On top of that, the harder the difficulty, the more time you'll lose upon getting hit.

Coming up next:

- Infinite jumps

- Infinite time
